verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 1:1
verses.text: The Instructions of Commodianus: Our author seems to have been a North-African bishop, of whom little is known save what we learn from his own writings.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 1:2
verses.text: He has been supposed to incline to some ideas of Praxeas, and also to the Millenarians, but perhaps on insufficient grounds.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 1:3
verses.text: His Millenarianism reflects the views of a very primitive age, and that without the corrupt Chiliasm of a later period, which brought about a practical repudiation of the whole system.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 1:4
verses.text: Of his writings, two poems only remain, and of these the second, a very recent discovery, has no place in the Edinburgh series.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 1:5
verses.text: I greatly regret that it cannot be included in ours.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 1:6
verses.text: As a poetical work the following prose version probably does it no injustice.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 1:7
verses.text: His versification is pronounced very crabbed, and his diction is the wretched patois of North Africa.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 1:8
verses.text: But the piety and earnestness of a practical Christian seem everywhere conspicuous in this fragment of antiquity.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 2:1
verses.text: Preface.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 2:2
verses.text: My preface sets forth the way to the wanderer and a good visitation when the goal of life shall have come, that he may become eternal—a thing which ignorant hearts disbelieve.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 2:3
verses.text: I in like manner have wandered for a long time, by giving attendance upon heathen fanes, my parents themselves being ignorant.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 2:4
verses.text: Thence at length I withdrew myself by reading concerning the law.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 2:5
verses.text: I bear witness to the Lord; I grieve alas, the crowd of citizens! ignorant of what it loses in going to seek vain gods.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 2:6
verses.text: Thoroughly taught by these things, I instruct the ignorant in the truth.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 3:1
verses.text: God's Indignation.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 3:2
verses.text: In the law, the Lord of heaven, and earth, and sea has commanded, saying, Worship not vain gods made by your own hands out of wood or gold, lest my wrath destroy you for such things.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 3:3
verses.text: The people before Moses, unskilled, abiding without law, and ignorant of God, prayed to gods that perished, after the likenesses of which they fashioned vain idols.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 3:4
verses.text: The Lord having brought the Jews out of the land of Egypt, subsequently imposed on them a law; and the Omnipotent enjoined these things, that they should serve Him alone, and not those idols.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 3:5
verses.text: Moreover, in that law is taught concerning the resurrection, and the hope of living in happiness again in the world, if vain idols be forsaken and not worshipped.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 4:1
verses.text: The Worship of Demons.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 4:2
verses.text: When Almighty God, to beautify the nature of the world, willed that that earth should be visited by angels, when they were sent down they despised His laws.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 4:3
verses.text: Such was the beauty of women, that it turned them aside; so that, being contaminated, they could not return to heaven.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 4:4
verses.text: Rebels from God, they uttered words against Him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 4:5
verses.text: Then the Highest uttered His judgment against them; and from their seed giants are said to have been born.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 4:6
verses.text: By them arts were made known in the earth, and they taught the dyeing of wool, and everything which is done; and to them, when they died, men erected images.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 4:7
verses.text: But the Almighty, because they were of an evil seed, did not approve that, when dead, they should be brought back from death.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 4:8
verses.text: Whence wandering they now subvert many bodies, and it is such as these especially that ye this day worship and pray to as gods.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 5:1
verses.text: Saturn.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 5:2
verses.text: And Saturn the old, if he is a god, how does he grow old?  Or if he was a god, why was he driven by his terrors to devour his children?  But because he was not a god, he consumed the bowels of his sons in a monstrous madness.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 5:3
verses.text: He was a king upon earth, born in the mount Olympus; and he was not divine, but called himself a god.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 5:4
verses.text: He fell into weakness of mind, and swallowed a stone for his son.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 5:5
verses.text: Thus he became a god; of late he is called Jupiter.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 6:1
verses.text: Jupiter.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 6:2
verses.text: This Jupiter was born to Saturn in the island of Breta; and when he was grown up, he deprived his father of the kingdom.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 6:3
verses.text: He then deluded the wives and sisters of the nobles.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 6:4
verses.text: Moreover, Pyracmon, a smith, had made for him a sceptre.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 6:5
verses.text: In the beginning God made the heaven, the earth, and the sea.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 6:6
verses.text: But that frightful creature, born in the midst of time, went forth as a youth from a cave, and was nourished by stealth.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 6:7
verses.text: Behold, that God is the author of all things, not that Jupiter.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 7:1
verses.text: Of the Same Jupiter's Thunderbolt.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 7:2
verses.text: Ye say, O fools, Jupiter thunders.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 7:3
verses.text: It is he that hurls thunderbolts; and if it was childishness that thought thus, why for two hundred years have ye been babies?  And will ye still be so always?  Infancy is passed into maturity, old age does not enjoy trifles, the age of boyhood has departed; let the mind of youth in like manner depart.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 7:4
verses.text: Your thoughts ought to belong to the character of men.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 7:5
verses.text: Thou art then a fool, to believe that it is Jupiter that thunders.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 7:6
verses.text: He, born on the earth, is nourished with goats' milk.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 7:7
verses.text: Therefore if Saturn had devoured him, who was it in those times that sent rain when he was dead?  Especially, if a god may be thought to be born of a mortal father, Saturn grew old on the earth, and on the earth he died.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 7:8
verses.text: There was none that predicted his previous birth.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 7:9
verses.text: Or if he thunders, the law would have been given by him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 7:10
verses.text: The stories that the poets feign seduce you.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 7:11
verses.text: He, however, reigned in Crete, and there died.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 7:12
verses.text: He who to you is the Almighty became Alcmena's lover; he himself would in like manner be in love with living men now if he were alive.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 7:13
verses.text: Ye pray to unclean gods, and ye call them heavenly who are born of mortal seed from those giants.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 7:14
verses.text: Ye hear and ye read that he was born in the earth:  whence was it that that corrupter so well deserved to ascend into heaven?  And the Cyclopes are said to have forged him a thunderbolt; for though he was immortal, he received arms from mortals.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 7:15
verses.text: Ye have conveyed to heaven by your authority one guilty of so many crimes, and, moreover, a parricide of his own relations.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 8:1
verses.text: Of the Septizonium and the Stars.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 8:2
verses.text: Your want of intelligence deceives you concerning the circle of the zone, and perchance from that you find out that you must pray to Jupiter.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 8:3
verses.text: Saturn is told of there, but it is as a star, for he was driven forth by Jupiter, or let Jupiter be believed to be in the star.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 8:4
verses.text: He who controlled the constellations of the pole, and the sower of the soil; he who made war with the Trojans, he loved the beautiful Venus.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 8:5
verses.text: Or among the stars themselves Mars was caught with her by married jealousy:  he is called the youthful god.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 8:6
verses.text: Oh excessively foolish, to think that those who are born of Maia rule from the stars, or that they rule the entire nature of the world!  Subjected to wounds, and themselves living under the dominion of the fates, obscene, inquisitive, warriors of an impious life; and they made sons, equally mortal with themselves, and were all terrible, foolish, strong, in the sevenfold girdle.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 8:7
verses.text: If ye worship the stars, worship also the twelve signs of the zodiac, as well the ram, the bull, the twins, as the fierce lion; and finally, they go on into fishes,—cook them and you will prove them.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 8:8
verses.text: A law without law is your refuge:  what wishes to be, will prevail.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 8:9
verses.text: A woman desires to be wanton; she seeks to live without restraint.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 8:10
verses.text: Ye yourselves will be what ye wish for, and pray to as gods and goddesses.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 8:11
verses.text: Thus I worshipped while I went astray, and now I condemn it.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 9:1
verses.text: Of the Sun and Moon.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 9:2
verses.text: Concerning the Sun and Moon ye are in error, although they are in our immediate presence; in that ye, as I formerly did, think that you must pray to them.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 9:3
verses.text: They, indeed, are among the stars; but they do not run of their own accord.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 9:4
verses.text: The Omnipotent, when He established all things at first, placed them there with the stars, on the fourth day.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 9:5
verses.text: And, indeed, He commanded in the law that none should worship them.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 9:6
verses.text: Ye worship so many gods who promise nothing concerning life, whose law is not on the earth, nor are they themselves foretold.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 9:7
verses.text: But a few priests seduce you, who say that any deity destined to die can be of service.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 9:8
verses.text: Draw near now, read, and learn the truth.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 10:1
verses.text: Mercury.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 10:2
verses.text: Let your Mercury be depicted with a Saraballum, and with wings on his helmet or his cap, and in other respects naked.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 10:3
verses.text: I see a marvellous thing, a god flying with a little satchel.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 10:4
verses.text: Run, poor creatures, with your lap spread open when he flies, that he may empty his satchel:  do ye from thence be prepared.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 10:5
verses.text: Look on the painted one, since he will thus cast you money from on high:  then dance ye securely.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 10:6
verses.text: Vain man, art thou not mad, to worship painted gods in heaven?  If thou knowest not how to live, continue to dwell with the beasts.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 11:1
verses.text: Neptune.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 11:2
verses.text: Ye make Neptune a god descended from Saturn; and he wields a trident that he may spear the fishes.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 11:3
verses.text: It is plain by his being thus provided that he is a sea-god.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 11:4
verses.text: Did not he himself with Apollo raise up walls for the Trojans?  How did that poor stone-mason become a god?  Did not he beget the cyclops-monster?  And was he himself when dead unable to live again, though his structure admitted of this?  Thus begotten, he begot who was already once dead.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 12:1
verses.text: Apollo the Soothsaying and False.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 12:2
verses.text: Ye make Apollo a player on the cithara, and divine.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 12:3
verses.text: Born at first of Maia, in the isle of Delos, subsequently, for offered wages, a builder, obeying the king Laomedon, he reared the walls of the Trojans.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 12:4
verses.text: And he established himself, and ye are seduced into thinking him a god, in whose bones the love of Cassandra burned, whom the virgin craftily sported with, and, though a divine being, he is deceived.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 12:5
verses.text: By his office of augur he was able to know the double-hearted one.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 12:6
verses.text: Moreover rejected, he, though divine, departed thence.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 12:7
verses.text: Him the virgin burnt up with her beauty, whom he ought to have burnt up; while she ought first of all to have loved the god who thus lustfully began to love Daphne, and still follows her up, wishing to violate the maid.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 12:8
verses.text: The fool loves in vain.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 12:9
verses.text: Nor can he obtain her by running.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 12:10
verses.text: Surely, if he were a god, he would come up with her through the air.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 12:11
verses.text: She first came under the roof, and the divine being remained outside.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 12:12
verses.text: The race of men deceive you, for they were of a sad way of life.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 12:13
verses.text: Moreover, he is said to have fed the cattle of Admetus.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 12:14
verses.text: While in imposed sports he threw the quoit into the air, he could not restrain it as it fell, and it killed his friend.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 12:15
verses.text: That was the last day of his companion Hyacinthus.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 12:16
verses.text: Had he been divine, he would have foreknown the death of his friend.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 13:1
verses.text: Father Liber—Bacchus.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 13:2
verses.text: Ye yourselves say that Father Liber was assuredly twice begotten.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 13:3
verses.text: First of all he was born in India of Proserpine and Jupiter, and waging war against the Titans, when his blood was shed, he expired even as one of mortal men.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 13:4
verses.text: Again, restored from his death, in another womb Semele conceived him again of Jupiter, a second Maia, whose womb being divided, he is taken away near to birth from his dead mother, and as a nursling is given to be nourished to Nisus.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 13:5
verses.text: From this being twice born he is called Dionysus; and his religion is falsely observed in vanity; and they celebrate his orgies such that now they themselves seem to be either foolhardy or burlesquers of Mimnermomerus.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 13:6
verses.text: They conspire in evil; they practise beforehand with pretended heat, that they may deceive others into saying that a deity is present.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 13:7
verses.text: Hence you manifestly see men living a life like his, violently excited with the wine which he himself had pressed out; they have given him divine honour in the midst of their drunken excess.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 14:1
verses.text: The Unconquered One.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 14:2
verses.text: The unconquered one was born from a rock, if he is regarded as a god.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 14:3
verses.text: Now tell us, then, on the other hand, which is the first of these two.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 14:4
verses.text: The rock has overcome the god:  then the creator of the rock has to be sought after.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 14:5
verses.text: Moreover, you still depict him also as a thief; although, if he were a god, he certainly did not live by theft.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 14:6
verses.text: Assuredly he was of earth, and of a monstrous nature.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 14:7
verses.text: And he turned other people's oxen into his caves; just as did Cacus, that son of Vulcan.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 15:1
verses.text: Sylvanus.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 15:2
verses.text: Whence, again, has Sylvanus appeared to be a god?  Perhaps it is agreeable so to call him from this, that the pipe sings sweetly because he bestows the wood; for, perhaps, it might not be so.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 15:3
verses.text: Thou hast bought a venal master, when thou shalt have bought from him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 15:4
verses.text: Behold the wood fails!  What is due to him?  Art thou not ashamed, O fool, to adore such pictures?  Seek one God who will allow you to live after death.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 15:5
verses.text: Depart from such as have become dead in life.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 16:1
verses.text: Hercules.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 16:2
verses.text: Hercules, because he destroyed the monster of the Aventine Mount, who had been wont to steal the herds of Evander, is a god:  the rustic mind of men, untaught also, when they wished to return thanks instead of praise to the absent thunderer, senselessly vowed victims as to a god to be besought, they made milky altars as a memorial to themselves.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 16:3
verses.text: Thence it arises that he is worshipped in the ancient manner.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 16:4
verses.text: But he is no god, although he was strong in arms.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 17:1
verses.text: Of the Gods and Goddesses.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 17:2
verses.text: Ye say that they are gods who are plainly cruel, and ye say that genesis assigns the fates to you.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 17:3
verses.text: Now, then, say to whom first of all sacred rites are paid.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 17:4
verses.text: Between the ways on either side immature death is straying.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 17:5
verses.text: If the fates give the generations, why do you pray to the god?  Thou art vainly deceived who art seeking to beseech the manes, and thou namest them to be lords over thee who are fabricated.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 17:6
verses.text: Or, moreover, I know not what women you pray to as goddesses—Bellona and Nemesis the goddesses, together with the celestial Fury, the Virgins and Venus, for whom your wives are weak in the loins.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 17:7
verses.text: Besides, there are in the lanes other demons which are not as yet numbered, and are worn on the neck, so that they themselves cannot give to themselves an account.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 17:8
verses.text: Plagues ought rather to be exported to the ends of the earth.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 18:1
verses.text: Of Their Images.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 18:2
verses.text: A few wicked and empty poets delude you; while they seek with difficulty to procure their living, they adorn falsehood to be for others under the guise of mystery.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 18:3
verses.text: Thence feigning to be smitten by some deity, they sing of his majesty, and weary themselves under his form.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 18:4
verses.text: Ye have often seen the Dindymarii, with what a din they enter upon luxuries while they seek to feign the furies, or when they strike their backs with the filthy axe, although with their teaching they keep what they heal by their blood.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 18:5
verses.text: Behold in what name they do not compel those who first of all unite themselves to them with a sound mind.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 18:6
verses.text: But that they may take away a gift, they seek such minds.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 18:7
verses.text: Thence see how all things are feigned.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 18:8
verses.text: They cast a shadow over a simple people, lest they should believe, while they perish, the thing once for all proceeded in vanity from antiquity, that a prophet who uttered false things might be believed; but their majesty has spoken nought.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 19:1
verses.text: Of Ammydates and the Great God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 19:2
verses.text: We have already said many things of an abominable superstition, and yet we follow up the subject, lest we should be said to have passed anything over.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 19:3
verses.text: And the worshippers worshipped their Ammydates after their manner.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 19:4
verses.text: He was great to them when there was gold in the temple.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 19:5
verses.text: They placed their heads under his power, as if he were present.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 19:6
verses.text: It came to the highest point that Caesar took away the gold.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 19:7
verses.text: The deity failed, or fled, or passed away into fire.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 19:8
verses.text: The author of this wickedness is manifest who formed this same god, and falsely prophesying seduces so many and so great men, and only was silent about Him who was accustomed to be divine.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 19:9
verses.text: For voices broke forth, as if with a changed mind, as if the wooden god were speaking into his ear.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 19:10
verses.text: Say now yourselves if they are not false deities?  From that prodigy how many has that prophet destroyed?  He forgot to prophesy who before was accustomed to prophesy; so those prodigies are feigned among those who are greedy of wine, whose damnable audacity feigns deities, for they were carried about, and such an image was dried up.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 19:11
verses.text: For both he himself is silent, and no one prophesies concerning him at all.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 19:12
verses.text: But ye wish to ruin yourselves.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 20:1
verses.text: Of the Vain Nemesiaci.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 20:2
verses.text: Is it not ignominy, that a prudent man should be seduced and worship such a one, or say that a log is Diana?  You trust a man who in the morning is drunk, costive, and ready to perish, who by art speaks falsely what is seen by him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 20:3
verses.text: While he lives strictly, he feeds on his own bowels.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 20:4
verses.text: A detestable one defiles all the citizens; and he has attached to himself—a similar gathering being made—those with whom he feigns the history, that he may adorn a god.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 20:5
verses.text: He is ignorant how to prophesy for himself; for others he dares it.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 20:6
verses.text: He places it on his shoulder when he pleases, and again he places it down.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 20:7
verses.text: Whirling round, he is turned by himself with the tree of the two-forked one, as if you would think that he was inspired with the deity of the wood.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 20:8
verses.text: Ye do not worship the gods whom they themselves falsely announce; ye worship the priests themselves, fearing them vainly.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 20:9
verses.text: But if thou art strong in heart, flee at once from the shrines of death.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 21:1
verses.text: The Titans.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 21:2
verses.text: Ye say that the Titans are to you Tutans.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 21:3
verses.text: Ye ask that these fierce ones should be silent under your roof, as so many Lares, shrines, images made like to a Titan.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 21:4
verses.text: For ye foolishly adore those who have died by an evil death, not reading their own law.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 21:5
verses.text: They themselves speak not, and ye dare to call them gods who are melted out of a brazen vessel; ye should rather melt them into little vessels for yourselves.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 22:1
verses.text: The Montesiani.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 22:2
verses.text: Ye call the mountains also gods.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 22:3
verses.text: Let them rule in gold, darkened by evil, and aiding with an averted mind.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 22:4
verses.text: For if a pure spirit and a serene mind remained to you, thou thyself ought to examine for thyself concerning them.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 22:5
verses.text: Thou art become senseless as a man, if thou thinkest that these can save thee, whether they rule or whether they cease.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 22:6
verses.text: If thou seekest anything healthy, seek rather the righteousness of the law, that brings the help of salvation, and says that you are becoming eternal.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 22:7
verses.text: For what you shall follow in vanity rejoices you for a time.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 22:8
verses.text: Thou art glad for a brief space, and afterwards bewailest in the depths.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 22:9
verses.text: Withdraw thyself from these, if thou wilt rise again with Christ.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 23:1
verses.text: The Dulness of the Age.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 23:2
verses.text: Alas, I grieve, citizens, that ye are thus blinded by the world.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 23:3
verses.text: One runs to the lot; another gazes on the birds; another, having shed the blood of bleating animals, calls forth the manes, and credulously desires to hear vain responses.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 23:4
verses.text: When so many leaders and kings have taken counsel concerning life, what benefit has it been to them to have known even its portents?  Learn, I beg you, citizens, what is good; beware of idol-fanes.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 23:5
verses.text: Seek, indeed, all of you, in the law of the Omnipotent.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 23:6
verses.text: Thus it has pleased the Lord of lords Himself in the heavens, that demons should wander in the world for our discipline.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 23:7
verses.text: And yet, on the other hand, He has sent out His mandates, that they who forsake their altars shall become inhabitants of heaven.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 23:8
verses.text: Whence I am not careful to argue this in a small treatise.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 23:9
verses.text: The law teaches; it calls on you in your midst.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 23:10
verses.text: Consider for yourselves.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 23:11
verses.text: Ye have entered upon two roads; decide upon the right one.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 24:1
verses.text: Of Those Who are Everywhere Ready.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 24:2
verses.text: While thou obeyest the belly, thou sayest that thou art innocent; and, as if courteously, makest thyself everywhere ready.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 24:3
verses.text: Woe to thee, foolish man! thou thyself lookest around upon death.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 24:4
verses.text: Thou seekest in a barbarous fashion to live without law.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 24:5
verses.text: Thou thyself hymnest thyself also to play upon a word, who feignest thyself simple.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 24:6
verses.text: I live in simplicity with such a one.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 24:7
verses.text: Thou believest that thou livest, whilst thou desirest to fill thy belly.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 24:8
verses.text: To sit down disgracefully of no account in thy house, ready for feasting, and to run away from precepts.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 24:9
verses.text: Or because thou believest not that God will judge the dead, thou foolishly makest thyself ruler of heaven instead of Him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 24:10
verses.text: Thou regardest thy belly as if thou canst provide for it.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 24:11
verses.text: Thou seemest at one time to be profane, at another to be holy.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 24:12
verses.text: Thou appearest as a suppliant of God, under the aspect of a tyrant.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 24:13
verses.text: Thou shalt feel in thy fates by whose law thou art aided.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 25:1
verses.text: Of Those Who Live Between the Two.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 25:2
verses.text: Thou who thinkest that, by living doubtfully between the two, thou art on thy guard, goest on thy way stript of law, broken down by luxury.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 25:3
verses.text: Thou art looking forward vainly to so many things, why seekest thou unjust things?  And whatever thou hast done shall there remain to thee when dead.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 25:4
verses.text: Consider, thou foolish one, thou wast not, and lo, thou art seen.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 25:5
verses.text: Thou knowest not whence thou hast proceeded, nor whence thou art nourished.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 25:6
verses.text: Thou avoidest the excellent and benignant God of thy life, and thy Governor, who would rather wish thee to live.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 25:7
verses.text: Thou turnest thyself to thyself, and givest thy back to God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 25:8
verses.text: Thou drownest thyself in darkness, whilst thou thinkest thou art abiding in light.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 25:9
verses.text: Why runnest thou in the synagogue to the Pharisees, that He may become merciful to thee, whom thou of thy own accord deniest?  Thence thou goest abroad again; thou seekest healthful things.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 25:10
verses.text: Thou wishest to live between both ways, but thence thou shalt perish.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 25:11
verses.text: And, moreover, thou sayest, Who is He who has redeemed from death, that we may believe in Him, since there punishments are awarded?  Ah! not thus, O malignant man, shall it be as thou thinkest.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 25:12
verses.text: For to him who has lived well there is advantage after death.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 25:13
verses.text: Thou, however, when one day thou diest, shalt be taken away in an evil place.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 25:14
verses.text: But they who believe in Christ shall be led into a good place, and those to whom that delight is given are caressed; but to you who are of a double mind, against you is punishment without the body.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 25:15
verses.text: The course of the tormentor stirs you up to cry out against your brother.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:1
verses.text: They Who Fear and Will Not Believe.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:2
verses.text: How long, O foolish man, wilt thou not acknowledge Christ?  Thou avoidest the fertile field, and castest thy seeds on the sterile one.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:3
verses.text: Thou seekest to abide in the wood where the thief is delaying.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:4
verses.text: Thou sayest, I also am of God; and thou wanderest out of doors.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:5
verses.text: Now at length, after so many invitations, enter within the palace.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:6
verses.text: Now is the harvest ripe, and the time so many times prepared.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:7
verses.text: Lo, now reap!  What! dost thou not repent?  Thence now, if thou hast not, gather the seasonable wines.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:8
verses.text: The time of believing to life is present in the time of death.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:9
verses.text: The first law of God is the foundation of the subsequent law.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:10
verses.text: Thee, indeed, it assigned to believe in the second law.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:11
verses.text: Nor are threats from Himself, but from it, powerful over thee.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:12
verses.text: Now astounded, swear that thou wilt believe in Christ; for the Old Testament proclaims concerning Him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:13
verses.text: For it is needful only to believe in Him who was dead, to be able to rise again to live for all time.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:14
verses.text: Therefore, if thou art one who disbelievest that these things shall be, at length he shall be overcome in his guilt in the second death.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:15
verses.text: I will declare things to come in few words in this little treatise.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:16
verses.text: In it can be known when hope must be preferred.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 26:17
verses.text: Still I exhort you as quickly as possible to believe in Christ.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:1
verses.text: To Those Who Resist the Law of Christ the Living God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:2
verses.text: Thou rejectest, unhappy one, the advantage of heavenly discipline, and rushest into death while wishing to stray without a bridle.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:3
verses.text: Luxury and the shortlived joys of the world are ruining thee, whence thou shalt be tormented in hell for all time.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:4
verses.text: They are vain joys with which thou art foolishly delighted.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:5
verses.text: Do not these make thee to be a man dead?  Cannot thirty years at length make thee a wise man?  Ignorant how thou hast first strayed, look upon ancient time, thou thinkest now to enjoy here a joyous life in the midst of wrongs.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:6
verses.text: These are the ruins of thy friends, wars, or wicked frauds, thefts with bloodshed:  the body is vexed with sores, and groaning and wailing is indulged; whether a slight disease invade thee, or thou art held down by long sickness, or thou art bereaved of thy children, or thou mournest over a lost wife.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:7
verses.text: All is a wilderness:  alas, dignities are hurried down from their height by vices and poverty; doubly so, assuredly, if thou languishest long.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:8
verses.text: And callest thou it life when this life of glass is mortal?  Consider now at length that this time is of no avail, but in the future you have hope without the craft of living.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:9
verses.text: Certainly the little children which have been snatched away desired to live.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:10
verses.text: Moreover, the young men who have been deprived of life, perchance were preparing to grow old, and they themselves were making ready to enjoy joyful days; and yet we unwillingly lay aside all things in the world.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:11
verses.text: I have delayed with a perverse mind, and I have thought that the life of this world was a true one; and I judged that death would come in like manner as ye did—that when once life had departed, the soul also was dead and perished.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:12
verses.text: These things, however, are not so; but the Founder and Author of the world has certainly required the brother slain by a brother.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:13
verses.text: Impious man, say, said He, where is thy brother? and he denied.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:14
verses.text: For the blood of thy brother has cried aloud to Me to heaven.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:15
verses.text: Thou art tormented, I see, when thou thoughtest to feel nothing; but he lives and occupies the place on the right hand.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:16
verses.text: He enjoys delights which thou, O wicked one, hast lost; and when thou hast called back the world, he also has gone before, and will be immortal:  for thou shalt wail in hell.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:17
verses.text: Certainly God lives, who makes the dead to live, that He may give worthy rewards to the innocent and to the good; but to the fierce and impious, cruel hell.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 27:18
verses.text: Commence, O thou who art led away, to perceive the judgments of God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:1
verses.text: O Fool, Thou Dost Not Die to God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:2
verses.text: O fool, thou dost not absolutely die; nor, when dead, dost thou escape the lofty One.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:3
verses.text: Although thou shouldst arrange that when dead thou perceivest nothing, thou shalt foolishly be overcome.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:4
verses.text: God the Creator of the world liveth, whose laws cry out that the dead are in existence.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:5
verses.text: But thou, whilst recklessly thou seekest to live without God, judgest that in death is extinction, and thinkest that it is absolute.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:6
verses.text: God has not ordered it as thou thinkest, that the dead are forgetful of what they have previously done.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:7
verses.text: Now has the governor made for us receptacles of death, and after our ashes we shall behold them.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:8
verses.text: Thou art stripped, O foolish one, who thinkest that by death thou art not, and hast made thy Ruler and Lord to be able to do nothing.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:9
verses.text: But death is not a mere vacuity, if thou reconsiderest in thine heart.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:10
verses.text: Thou mayest know that He is to be desired, for late thou shalt perceive Him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:11
verses.text: Thou wast the ruler of the flesh; certainly flesh ruled not thee.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:12
verses.text: Freed from it, the former is buried; thou art here.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:13
verses.text: Rightly is mortal man separated from the flesh.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:14
verses.text: Therefore mortal eyes will not be able to be equalled (to divine things).

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:15
verses.text: Thus our depth keeps us from the secret of God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:16
verses.text: Give thou now, whilst in weakness thou art dying, the honour to God, and believe that Christ will bring thee back living from the dead.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 28:17
verses.text: Thou oughtest to give praises in the church to the omnipotent One.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 29:1
verses.text: The Righteous Rise Again.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 29:2
verses.text: Righteousness and goodness, peace and true patience, and care concerning one's deeds, make to live after death.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 29:3
verses.text: But a crafty mind, mischievous, perfidious, evil, destroys itself by degrees, and delays in a cruel death.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 29:4
verses.text: O wicked man, hear now what thou gainest by thy evil deeds.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 29:5
verses.text: Look on the judges of earth, who now in the body torture with terrible punishments; either chastisements are prepared for the deserving by the sword, or to weep in a long imprisonment.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 29:6
verses.text: Dost thou, last of all, hope to laugh at the God of heaven and the Ruler of the sky, by whom all things were made?  Thou ragest, thou art mad, and now thou takest away the name of God, from whom, moreover, thou shalt not escape; and He will award punishments according to your deeds.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 29:7
verses.text: Now I would have you be cautious that thou come not to the burning of fire.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 29:8
verses.text: Give thyself up at once to Christ, that goodness may attend thee.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 30:1
verses.text: To the Wicked and Unbelieving Rich Man.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 30:2
verses.text: Thou wilt, O rich man, by insatiably looking too much to all thy wealth, squander those things to which thou art still seeking to cling.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 30:3
verses.text: Thou sayest, I do not hope when dead to live after such things as these.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 30:4
verses.text: O ungrateful to the great God, who thus judgest thyself to be a god; to Him who, when thou knewest nothing of it, brought thee forth, and then nourished thee.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 30:5
verses.text: He governs thy meadows; He, thy vineyards; He, thy herd of cattle; and He, whatever thou possessest.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 30:6
verses.text: Nor dost thou give heed to these things; or thou, perchance, rulest all things.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 30:7
verses.text: He who made the sky, and the earth, and the salt seas, decreed to give us back again ourselves in a golden age.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 30:8
verses.text: And only if thou believest, thou livest in the secret of God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 30:9
verses.text: Learn God, O foolish man, who wishes thee to be immortal, that thou mayest give Him eternal thanks in thy struggle.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 30:10
verses.text: His own law teaches thee; but since thou seekest to wander, thou disbelievest all things, and thence thou shalt go into hell.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 30:11
verses.text: By and by thou givest up thy life; thou shalt be taken where it grieveth thee to be:  there the spiritual punishment, which is eternal, is undergone; there are always wailings:  nor dost thou absolutely die therein—there at length too late proclaiming the omnipotent God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:1
verses.text: Rich Men, Be Humble.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:2
verses.text: Learn, O thou who art about to die, to show thyself good to all.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:3
verses.text: Why, in the midst of the people, makest thou thyself to be another than thou art?  Thou goest where thou knowest not, and ignorantly thence thou departest.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:4
verses.text: Thou managest wickedly with thy very body; thou thirstest always after riches.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:5
verses.text: Thou exaltest thyself too much on high; and thou bearest pride, and dost not willingly look on the poor.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:6
verses.text: Now ye do not even feed your parents themselves when placed under you.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:7
verses.text: Ah, wretched men, let ordinary men flee far from you.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:8
verses.text: He lived, and I have destroyed him; the poor man cries out εὕρηκα.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:9
verses.text: By and by thou shalt be driven with the furies of Charybdis, when thou thyself dost perish.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:10
verses.text: Thus ye rich men are undisciplined, ye give a law to those, ye yourselves not being prepared.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:11
verses.text: Strip thyself, O rich man turned away from God, of such evils, if assuredly, perchance, what thou hast seen done may aid thee.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:12
verses.text: Be ye the attendant of God while ye have time.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:13
verses.text: Even as the elm loves the vine, so love ye people of no account.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:14
verses.text: Observe now, O barren one, the law which is terrible to the evil, and equally benignant to the good; be humble in prosperity.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:15
verses.text: Take away, O rich men, hearts of fraud, and take up hearts of peace.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:16
verses.text: And look upon your evil-doing.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 31:17
verses.text: Do ye do good?  I am here.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 32:1
verses.text: To Judges.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 32:2
verses.text: Consider the sayings of Solomon, all ye judges; in what way, with one word of his, he disparages you.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 32:3
verses.text: How gifts and presents corrupt the judges, thence, thence follows the law.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 32:4
verses.text: Ye always love givers; and when there shall be a cause, the unjust cause carries off the victory.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 32:5
verses.text: Thus I am innocent; nor do I, a man of no account, accuse you, because Solomon openly raises the blasphemy.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 32:6
verses.text: But your god is your belly, and rewards are your laws.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 32:7
verses.text: Paul the apostle suggests this, I am not deceitful.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 33:1
verses.text: To Self-Pleasers.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 33:2
verses.text: If place or time is favourable, or the person has advanced, let there be a new judge.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 33:3
verses.text: Why now art thou lifted up thence?  Untaught, thou blasphemest Him of whose liberality thou livest.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 33:4
verses.text: In such weakness thou dost not ever regard Him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 33:5
verses.text: Throughout advances and profits thou greedily presumest on fortune.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 33:6
verses.text: There is no law to thee, nor dost thou discern thyself in prosperity.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 33:7
verses.text: Although they may be counted of gold, let the strains of the pipe always be raving.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 33:8
verses.text: If thou hast not adored the crucifixion of the Lord, thou hast perished.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 33:9
verses.text: Both place and occasion and person are now given to thee, if, however, thou believest; but if not, thou shalt fear before Him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 33:10
verses.text: Bring thyself into obedience to Christ, and place thy neck under Him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 33:11
verses.text: To Him remains the honour and all the confidence of things.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 33:12
verses.text: When the time flatters thee, be more cautious.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 33:13
verses.text: Not foreseeing, as it behoves thee, the final awards of fate, thou art not able ever to live again without Christ.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 34:1
verses.text: To the Gentiles.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 34:2
verses.text: O people, ferocious, without a shepherd, now at length wander not.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 34:3
verses.text: For I also who admonish you was the same, ignorant, wandering.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 34:4
verses.text: Now, therefore, take the likeness of your Lord.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 34:5
verses.text: Raise upward your wild and roughened hearts.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 34:6
verses.text: Enter stedfastly into the fold of your sylvan Shepherd, remaining safe from robbers under the royal roof.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 34:7
verses.text: In the wood are wolves; therefore take refuge in the cave.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 34:8
verses.text: Thou warrest, thou art mad; nor dost thou behold where thou abidest.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 34:9
verses.text: Believe in the one God, that when dead thou mayest live, and mayest rise in His kingdom, when there shall be the resurrection to the just.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:1
verses.text: Moreover, to Ignorant Gentiles.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:2
verses.text: The unsubdued neck refuses to bear the yoke of labour.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:3
verses.text: Then it delights to be satisfied with herbs in the rich plains.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:4
verses.text: And still unwillingly is subdued the useful mare, and it is made to be less fierce when it is first brought into subjection.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:5
verses.text: O people, O man, thou brother, do not be a brutal flock.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:6
verses.text: Pluck thyself forth at length, and thyself withdraw thyself.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:7
verses.text: Assuredly thou art not cattle, thou art not a beast, but thou art born a man.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:8
verses.text: Do thou thyself wisely subdue thyself, and enter under arms.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:9
verses.text: Thou who followest idols art nothing but the vanity of the age.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:10
verses.text: Your trifling hearts destroy you when almost set free.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:11
verses.text: There gold, garments, silver is brought to the elbows; there war is made; there love is sung of instead of psalms.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:12
verses.text: Dost thou think it to be life, when thou playest or lookest forward to such things as these?  Thou choosest, O ignorant one, things that are extinct; thou seekest golden things.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:13
verses.text: Thence thou shalt not escape the plague, although thyself art divine.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:14
verses.text: Thou seekest not that grace which God sent to be read of in the earth, but thus as a beast thou wanderest.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:15
verses.text: The golden age before spoken of shall come to thee if thou believest, and again thou shalt begin to live always an immortal life.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:16
verses.text: That also is permitted to know what thou wast before.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 35:17
verses.text: Give thyself as a subject to God, who governs all things.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:1
verses.text: Of the Tree of Life and Death.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:2
verses.text: Adam was the first who fell, and that he might shun the precepts of God, Belial was his tempter by the lust of the palm tree.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:3
verses.text: And he conferred on us also what he did, whether of good or of evil, as being the chief of all that was born from him; and thence we die by his means, as he himself, receding from the divine, became an outcast from the Word.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:4
verses.text: We shall be immortal when six thousand years are accomplished.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:5
verses.text: The tree of the apple being tasted, death has entered into the world.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:6
verses.text: By this tree of death we are born to the life to come.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:7
verses.text: On the tree depends the life that bears fruits—precepts.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:8
verses.text: Now, therefore, pluck believingly the fruits of life.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:9
verses.text: A law was given from the tree to be feared by the primitive man, whence comes death by the neglect of the law of the beginning.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:10
verses.text: Now stretch forth your hand, and take of the tree of life.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:11
verses.text: The excellent law of the Lord which follows has issued from the tree.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:12
verses.text: The first law is lost; man eats whence he can, who adores the forbidden gods, the evil joys of life.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:13
verses.text: Reject this partaking; it will suffice you to know what it should be.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:14
verses.text: If you wish to live, surrender yourselves to the second law.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:15
verses.text: Avoid the worship of temples, the oracles of demons; turn yourselves to Christ, and ye shall be associates with God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:16
verses.text: Holy is God's law, which teaches the dead to live.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:17
verses.text: God alone has commanded us to offer to Him the hymn of praise.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 36:18
verses.text: All of you shun absolutely the law of the devil.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 37:1
verses.text: Of the Foolishness of the Cross.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 37:2
verses.text: I have spoken of the twofold sign whence death proceeded, and again I have said that thence life frequently proceeds; but the cross has become foolishness to an adulterous people.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 37:3
verses.text: The awful King of eternity shadows forth these things by the cross, that they may now believe on Him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 37:4
verses.text: O fools, that live in death!  Cain slew his younger brother by the invention of wickedness.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 37:5
verses.text: Thence the sons of Enoch are said to be the race of Cain.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 37:6
verses.text: Then the evil people increased in the world, which never transfers souls to God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 37:7
verses.text: To believe the cross came to be a dread, and they say that they live righteously.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 37:8
verses.text: The first law was in the tree; and thence, too, the second.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 37:9
verses.text: And thence the second law first of all overcame the terrible law with peace.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 37:10
verses.text: Lifted up, they have rushed into vain prevarications.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 37:11
verses.text: They are unwilling to acknowledge the Lord pierced with nails; but when His judgment shall come, they will then discern Him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 37:12
verses.text: But the race of Abel already believes on a merciful Christ.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:1
verses.text: The Fanatics Who Judaize.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:2
verses.text: What! art thou half a Jew? wilt thou be half profane?  Whence thou shalt not when dead escape the judgment of Christ.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:3
verses.text: Thou thyself blindly wanderest, and foolishly goest in among the blind.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:4
verses.text: And thus the blind leadeth the blind into the ditch.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:5
verses.text: Thou goest whither thou knowest not, and thence ignorantly withdrawest.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:6
verses.text: Let them who are learning go to the learned, and let the learned depart.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:7
verses.text: But thou goest to those from whom thou canst learn nothing.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:8
verses.text: Thou goest forth before the doors, and thence also thou goest to the idols.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:9
verses.text: Ask first of all what is commanded in the law.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:10
verses.text: Let them tell thee if it be commanded to adore the gods; for they are ignored in respect of that which they are especially able to do.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:11
verses.text: But because they are guilty of that very crime, they relate nothing concerning the commandments of God save what is marvellous.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:12
verses.text: Then, however, they blindly lead you with them into the ditch.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:13
verses.text: There are deaths too well known by them to relate, or because the heaping up of the plough closes up the field.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:14
verses.text: The Almighty would not have them understand their King.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:15
verses.text: Why such a wickedness?  He Himself took refuge from those bloody men.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:16
verses.text: He gave Himself to us by a superadded law.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:17
verses.text: Thence now they lie concealed with us, deserted by their King.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 38:18
verses.text: But if you think that in them there is hope, you are altogether in error if you worship God and heathen temples.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 39:1
verses.text: To the Jews.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 39:2
verses.text: Evil always, and recalcitrant, with a stiff neck ye wish not that ye should be overcome; thus ye will be heirs.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 39:3
verses.text: Isaiah said that ye were of hardened heart.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 39:4
verses.text: Ye look upon the law which Moses in wrath dashed to pieces; and the same Lord gave to him a second law.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 39:5
verses.text: In that he placed his hope; but ye, half healed, reject it, and therefore ye shall not be worthy of the kingdom of heaven.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 40:1
verses.text: Also to the Jews.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 40:2
verses.text: Look upon Leah, that was a type of the synagogue, which Jacob received as a sign, with eyes so weak; and yet he served again for the younger one beloved:  a true mystery, and a type of our Church.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 40:3
verses.text: Consider what was abundantly said of Rebecca from heaven; whence, imitating the alien, ye may believe in Christ.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 40:4
verses.text: Thence come to Tamar and the offspring of twins.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 40:5
verses.text: Look to Cain, the first tiller of the earth, and Abel the shepherd, who was an unspotted offerer in the ruin of his brother, and was slain by his brother.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 40:6
verses.text: Thus therefore perceive, that the younger are approved by Christ.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 41:1
verses.text: Again to the Same.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 41:2
verses.text: There is not an unbelieving people such as yours.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 41:3
verses.text: O evil men! in so many places, and so often rebuked by the law of those who cry aloud.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 41:4
verses.text: And the lofty One despises your Sabbaths, and altogether rejects your universal monthly feasts according to law, that ye should not make to Him the commanded sacrifices; who told you to throw a stone for your offence.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 41:5
verses.text: If any should not believe that He had perished by an unjust death, and that those who were beloved were saved by other laws, thence that life was suspended on the tree, and believe not on Him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 41:6
verses.text: God Himself is the life; He Himself was suspended for us.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 41:7
verses.text: But ye with indurated heart insult Him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 42:1
verses.text: Of the Time of Antichrist.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 42:2
verses.text: Isaiah said:  This is the man who moveth the world and so many kings, and under whom the land shall become desert.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 42:3
verses.text: Hear ye how the prophet foretold concerning him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 42:4
verses.text: I have said nothing elaborately, but negligently.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 42:5
verses.text: Then, doubtless, the world shall be finished when he shall appear.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 42:6
verses.text: He himself shall divide the globe into three ruling powers, when, moreover, Nero shall be raised up from hell, Elias shall first come to seal the beloved ones; at which things the region of Africa and the northern nation, the whole earth on all sides, for seven years shall tremble.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 42:7
verses.text: But Elias shall occupy the half of the time, Nero shall occupy half.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 42:8
verses.text: Then the whore Babylon, being reduced to ashes, its embers shall thence advance to Jerusalem; and the Latin conqueror shall then say, I am Christ, whom ye always pray to; and, indeed, the original ones who were deceived combine to praise him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 42:9
verses.text: He does many wonders, since his is the false prophet.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 42:10
verses.text: Especially that they may believe him, his image shall speak.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 42:11
verses.text: The Almighty has given it power to appear such.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 42:12
verses.text: The Jews, recapitulating Scriptures from him, exclaim at the same time to the Highest that they have been deceived.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:1
verses.text: Of the Hidden and Holy People of the Almighty Christ, the Living God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:2
verses.text: Let the hidden, the final, the holy people be longed for; and, indeed, let it be unknown by us where it abides, acting by nine of the tribes and a half…; and he has bidden to live by the former law.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:3
verses.text: Now let us all live:  the tradition of the law is new, as the law itself teaches, I point out to you more plainly.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:4
verses.text: Two of the tribes and a half are left:  wherefore is the half of the tribes separated from them?  That they might be martyrs, when He should bring war on His elected ones into the world; or certainly the choir of the holy prophets would rise together upon the people who should impose a check upon them whom the obscene horses have slaughtered with kicking heel; nor would the band hurry rashly at any time to the gift of peace.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:5
verses.text: Those of the tribes are withdrawn, and all the mysteries of Christ are fulfilled by them throughout the whole age.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:6
verses.text: Moreover, they have arisen from the crime of two brothers, by whose auspices they have followed crime.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:7
verses.text: Not undeservedly are these bloody ones thus scattered:  they shall again assemble on behalf of the mysteries of Christ.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:8
verses.text: But then the things told of in the law are hastening to their completion.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:9
verses.text: The Almighty Christ descends to His elect, who have been darkened from our view for so long a time—they have become so many thousands—that is the true heavenly people.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:10
verses.text: The son does not die before his father, then; nor do they feel pains in their bodies, nor polypus in their nostrils.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:11
verses.text: They who cease depart in ripe years in their bed, fulfilling all the things of the law, and therefore they are protected.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:12
verses.text: They are bidden to pass on the right side of their Lord; and when they have passed over as before, He dries up the river.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:13
verses.text: Nor less does the Lord Himself also proceed with them.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:14
verses.text: He has passed over to our side, they come with the King of heaven; and in their journey, what shall I speak of which God will bring to pass?  Mountains subside before them, and fountains break forth.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:15
verses.text: The creation rejoices to see the heavenly people.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:16
verses.text: Here, however, they hasten to defend the captive matron.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:17
verses.text: But the wicked king who possesses her, when he hears, flies into the parts of the north, and collects all his followers.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:18
verses.text: Moreover, when the tyrant shall dash himself against the army of God, his soldiery are overthrown by the celestial terror; the false prophet himself is seized with the wicked one, by the decree of the Lord; they are handed over alive to Gehenna.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:19
verses.text: From him chiefs and leaders are bidden to obey; then will the holy ones enter into the breasts of their ancient mother, that, moreover, they also may be refreshed whom he has evil persuaded.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:20
verses.text: With various punishments he will torment those who trust in him; they come to the end, whereby offences are taken away from the world.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 43:21
verses.text: The Lord will begin to give judgment by fire.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 44:1
verses.text: Of the End of This Age.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 44:2
verses.text: The trumpet gives the sign in heaven, the lion being taken away, and suddenly there is darkness with the din of heaven.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 44:3
verses.text: The Lord casts down His eyes, so that the earth trembles.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 44:4
verses.text: He cries out, so that all may hear throughout the world:  Behold, long have I been silent while I bore your doings in such a time.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 44:5
verses.text: They cry out together, complaining and groaning too late.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 44:6
verses.text: They howl, they bewail; nor is there room found for the wicked.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 44:7
verses.text: What shall the mother do for the sucking child, when she herself is burnt up?  In the flame of fire the Lord will judge the wicked.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 44:8
verses.text: But the fire shall not touch the just, but shall by all means lick them up.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 44:9
verses.text: In one place they delay, but a part has wept at the judgment.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 44:10
verses.text: Such will be the heat, that the stones themselves shall melt.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 44:11
verses.text: The winds assemble into lightnings, the heavenly wrath rages; and wherever the wicked man fleeth, he is seized upon by this fire.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 44:12
verses.text: There will be no succour nor ship of he sea.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 44:13
verses.text: Amen flames on the nations, and the Medes and Parthians burn for a thousand years, as the hidden words of John declare.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 44:14
verses.text: For then after a thousand years they are delivered over to Gehenna; and he whose work they were, with them are burnt up.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 45:1
verses.text: Of the First Resurrection.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 45:2
verses.text: From heaven will descend the city in the first resurrection; this is what we may tell of such a celestial fabric.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 45:3
verses.text: We shall arise again to Him, who have been devoted to Him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 45:4
verses.text: And they shall be incorruptible, even already living without death.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 45:5
verses.text: And neither will there be any grief nor any groaning in that city.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 45:6
verses.text: They shall come also who overcame cruel martyrdom under Antichrist, and they themselves live for the whole time, and receive blessings because they have suffered evil things; and they themselves marrying, beget for a thousand years.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 45:7
verses.text: There are prepared all the revenues of the earth, because the earth renewed without end pours forth abundantly.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 45:8
verses.text: Therein are no rains; no cold comes into the golden camp.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 45:9
verses.text: No sieges as now, nor rapines, nor does that city crave the light of a lamp.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 45:10
verses.text: It shines from its Founder.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 45:11
verses.text: Moreover, Him it obeys; in breadth , furlongs and length and depth.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 45:12
verses.text: It levels its foundation in the earth, but it raises its head to heaven.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 45:13
verses.text: In the city before the doors, moreover, sun and moon shall shine; he who is evil is hedged up in torment, for the sake of the nourishment of the righteous.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 45:14
verses.text: But from the thousand years God will destroy all those evils.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 46:1
verses.text: Of the Day of Judgment.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 46:2
verses.text: I add something, on account of unbelievers, of the day of judgment.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 46:3
verses.text: Again, the fire of the Lord sent forth shall be appointed.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 46:4
verses.text: The earth gives a true groan; then those who are making their journey in the last end, and then all unbelievers, groan.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 46:5
verses.text: The whole of nature is converted in flame, which yet avoids the camp of His saints.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 46:6
verses.text: The earth is burned up from its foundations, and the mountains melt.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 46:7
verses.text: Of the sea nothing remains:  it is overcome by the powerful fire.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 46:8
verses.text: This sky perishes, and the stars and these things are changed.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 46:9
verses.text: Another newness of sky and of everlasting earth is arranged.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 46:10
verses.text: Thence they who deserve it are sent away in a second death, but the righteous are placed in inner dwelling-places.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 47:1
verses.text: To Catechumens.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 47:2
verses.text: In few words, I admonish all believers in Christ, who have forsaken idols, for your salvation.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 47:3
verses.text: In the first times, if in any way thou fallest into error, still, when entreated, do thou leave all things for Christ; and since thou hast known God, be a recruit good and approved, and let virgin modesty dwell with thee in purity.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 47:4
verses.text: Let the mind be watchful for good things.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 47:5
verses.text: Beware that thou fall not into former sins.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 47:6
verses.text: In baptism the coarse dress of thy birth is washed.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 47:7
verses.text: For if any sinful catechumen is marked with punishment, let him live in the signs of Christianity, although not without loss.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 47:8
verses.text: The whole of the matter for thee is this, Do thou ever shun great sins.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 48:1
verses.text: To the Faithful.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 48:2
verses.text: I admonish the faithful not to hold their brethren in hatred.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 48:3
verses.text: Hatreds are accounted impious by martyrs for the flame.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 48:4
verses.text: The martyr is destroyed whose confession is of such kind; nor is it taught that the evil is expiated by the shedding of blood.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 48:5
verses.text: A law is given to the unjust man that he may restrain himself.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 48:6
verses.text: Thence he ought to be free from craft; so also oughtest thou.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 48:7
verses.text: Twice dost thou sin against God, if thou extendest strifes to thy brother; whence thou shalt not avoid sin following thy former courses.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 48:8
verses.text: Thou hast once been washed:  shalt thou be able to be immersed again?.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 49:1
verses.text: O Faithful, Beware of Evil.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 49:2
verses.text: The birds are deceived, and the beasts of the woods in the woods, by those very charms by which their ruin is ever accomplished, and caves as well as food deceive them as they follow; and they know not how to shun evil, nor are they restrained by law.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 49:3
verses.text: Law is given to man, and a doctrine of life to be chosen, from which he remembers that he may be able to live carefully, and recalls his own place, and takes away those things which belong to death.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 49:4
verses.text: He severely condemns himself who forsakes rule; either bound with iron, or cast down from his degree; or deprived of life, he loses what he ought to enjoy.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 49:5
verses.text: Warned by example, do not sin gravely; translated by the laver, rather have charity; flee far from the bait of the mouse-trap, where there is death.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 49:6
verses.text: Many are the martyrdoms which are made without shedding of blood.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 49:7
verses.text: Not to desire other men's goods; to wish to have the benefit of martyrdom; to bridle the tongue, thou oughtest to make thyself humble; not willingly to use force, nor to return force used against thee, thou wilt be a patient mind, understand that thou art a martyr.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 50:1
verses.text: To Penitents.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 50:2
verses.text: Thou art become a penitent; pray night and day; yet from thy Mother the Church do not far depart, and the Highest will be able to be merciful to thee.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 50:3
verses.text: The confession of thy fault shall not be in vain.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 50:4
verses.text: Equally in thy state of accusation learn to weep manifestly.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 50:5
verses.text: Then, if thou hast a wound, seek herbs and a physician; and yet in thy punishments thou shalt be able to mitigate thy sufferings.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 50:6
verses.text: For I will even confess that I alone of you am here, and that terror must be foregone.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 50:7
verses.text: I have myself felt the destruction; and therefore I warn those who are wounded to walk more cautiously, to put thy hair and thy beard in the dust of the earth, and to be clothed in sackcloth, and to entreat from the highest King will aid thee, that thou perish not perchance from among the people.
