verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 51:1
verses.text: Who Have Apostatized from God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 51:2
verses.text: Moreover, when war is waged, or an enemy attacks, if one be able either to conquer or to be hidden, they are great trophies; but unhappy will he be who shall be taken by them.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 51:3
verses.text: He loses country and king who has been unwilling to fight worthily for the truth, for his country, or for life.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 51:4
verses.text: He ought to die rather than go under a barbarian king; and let him seek slavery who is willing to transfer himself to enemies without law.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 51:5
verses.text: Then, if in warring thou shouldst die for thy king, thou hast conquered, or if thou hast given thy hands, thou hast perished uninjured by law.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 51:6
verses.text: The enemy crosses the river; do thou hide under thy lurking-place; or, if he can enter or not, do not linger.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 51:7
verses.text: Everywhere make thyself safe, and thy friends also; thou hast conquered.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 51:8
verses.text: And take watchful care lest any one enter in that lurking-place.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 51:9
verses.text: It will be an infamous thing if any one declares himself to the enemy.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 51:10
verses.text: He who knows not how to conquer, and runs to deliver himself up, has weakly foregone praise for neither his own nor his country's good.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 51:11
verses.text: Then he was unwilling to live, since life itself will perish.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 51:12
verses.text: If any one is without God, or profane from the enemy, they are become as sounding brass, or deaf as adders:  such men ought abundantly to pray or to hide themselves.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 52:1
verses.text: Of Infants.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 52:2
verses.text: The enemy has suddenly come flooding us over with war; and before they could flee, he has seized upon the helpless children.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 52:3
verses.text: They cannot be reproached, although they are seen to be taken captive; nor, indeed, do I excuse them.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 52:4
verses.text: Perhaps they have deserved it on account of the faults of their parents; therefore God has given them up.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 52:5
verses.text: However, I exhort the adults that they run to arms, and that they should be born again, as it were, to their Mother from the womb.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 52:6
verses.text: Let them avoid a law that is terrible, and always bloody, impious, intractable, living with the life of the beasts; for when another war by chance should be to be waged, he who should be able to conquer or even rightly to know how to beware.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 53:1
verses.text: Deserters.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 53:2
verses.text: For deserters are not called so as all of one kind.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 53:3
verses.text: One is wicked, another partially withdraws; but yet true judgments are decreed for both.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 53:4
verses.text: So Christ is fought against, even as Caesar is obeyed.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 53:5
verses.text: Seek the refuge of the king, if thou hast been a delinquent.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 53:6
verses.text: Do thou implore of Him; do thou prostrate confess to Him:  He will grant all things whose also are all our things.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 53:7
verses.text: The camp being replaced, beware of sinning further; do not wander long as a soldier through caves of the wild beasts.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 53:8
verses.text: Let it be sin to thee to cease from unmeasured doing.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 54:1
verses.text: To the Soldiers of Christ.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 54:2
verses.text: When thou hast given thy name to the warfare, thou art held by a bridle.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 54:3
verses.text: Therefore begin thou to put away thy former doings.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 54:4
verses.text: Shun luxuries, since labour is threatening arms.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 54:5
verses.text: With all thy virtue thou must obey the king's command, if thou wishest to attain the last times in gladness.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 54:6
verses.text: He is a good soldier, always wait for things to be enjoyed.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 54:7
verses.text: Be unwilling to flatter thyself; absolutely put away sloth, that thou mayest daily be ready for what is set before thee.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 54:8
verses.text: Be careful beforehand; in the morning revisit the standards.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 54:9
verses.text: When thou seest the war, take the nearest contest.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 54:10
verses.text: This is the king's glory, to see the soldiery prepared.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 54:11
verses.text: The king is present; desire that ye may fight beyond his hope.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 54:12
verses.text: He makes ready gifts.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 54:13
verses.text: He gladly looks for the victory, and assigns you to be a fit follower.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 54:14
verses.text: Do thou be unwilling to spare thyself besides for Belial; be thou rather diligent, that he may give fame for your death.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 55:1
verses.text: Of Fugitives.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 55:2
verses.text: The souls of those that are lost deservedly of themselves separate themselves.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 55:3
verses.text: Begotten of him, they again recur to those things which are his.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 55:4
verses.text: The root of Cain, the accursed seed, breaks forth and takes refuge in the servile nation under a barbarian king; and there the eternal flame will torment on the day decreed.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 55:5
verses.text: The fugitive will wander vaguely without discipline, loosed from law to go about through the defiles of the ways.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 55:6
verses.text: These, therefore, are such whom no penalty has restrained.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 55:7
verses.text: If they will not live, they ought to be seen by the idols.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 56:1
verses.text: Of the Seed of the Tares.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 56:2
verses.text: Of the seed of the tares, who stand mingled in the Church.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 56:3
verses.text: When the times of the harvest are filled up, the tares that have sprung up are separated from the fruit, because God had not sent them.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 56:4
verses.text: The husbandman separates all those collected tares.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 56:5
verses.text: The law is our field; whoever does good in it, assuredly the Ruler Himself will afford a true repose, for the tares are burned with fire.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 56:6
verses.text: If, therefore, you think that under one they are delaying, you are wrong.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 56:7
verses.text: I designate you as barren Christians; cursed was the fig-tree without fruit in the word of the Lord, and immediately it withered away.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 56:8
verses.text: Ye do not works; ye prepare no gift for the treasury, and yet ye thus vainly think to deserve well of the Lord.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 57:1
verses.text: To the Dissembler.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 57:2
verses.text: Dost thou dissemble with the law that was given with such public announcement, crying out in the heavenly word of so many prophets?  If a prophet had only cried out to the clouds, the word of the Lord uttered by him would surely suffice.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 57:3
verses.text: The law of the Lord proclaims itself into so many volumes of prophets; none of them excuses wickedness; thus even thou wishest from the heart to see good things; thou art also seeking to live by deceits.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 57:4
verses.text: Why, then, has the law itself gone forth with so much pains?  Thou abusest the commands of the Lord, and yet thou callest thyself His son.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 57:5
verses.text: Thou art seen, if thou wilt be such without reason.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 57:6
verses.text: I say, the Almighty seeks the meek to be His sons, those who are upright with a good heart, those who are devoted to the divine law; but ye know already where He has plunged the wicked.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 58:1
verses.text: That Worldly Things are Absolutely to Be Avoided.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 58:2
verses.text: If certain teachers, while looking for your gifts or fearing your persons, relax individual things to you, not only do I not grieve, but I am compelled to speak the truth.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 58:3
verses.text: Thou art going to vain shows with the crowd of the evil one, where Satan is at work in the circus with din.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 58:4
verses.text: Thou persuadest thyself that everything that shall please thee is lawful.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 58:5
verses.text: Thou art the offspring of the Highest, mingled with the sons of the devil.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 58:6
verses.text: Dost thou wish to see the former things which thou hast renounced?  Art thou again conversant with them?  What shall the Anointed One profit thee?  Or if it is permitted, on account of weakness, that thou foolishly profane…Love not the world, nor its contents.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 58:7
verses.text: Such is God's word, and it seems good to thee.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 58:8
verses.text: Thou observest man's command, and shunnest God's.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 58:9
verses.text: Thou trustedst to the gift whereby the teachers shut up their mouths, that they may be silent, and not tell thee the divine commands; while I speak the truth, as thou art bound look to the Highest.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 58:10
verses.text: Assign thyself as a follower to Him whose son thou wast.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 58:11
verses.text: If thou seekest to live, being a believing man, as do the Gentiles, the joys of the world remove thee from the grace of Christ.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 58:12
verses.text: With an undisciplined mind thou seekest what thou presumest to be easily lawful, both thy dear actors and their musical strains; nor carest thou that the offspring of such an one should babble follies.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 58:13
verses.text: While thou thinkest that thou art enjoying life, thou art improvidently erring.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 58:14
verses.text: The Highest commands, and thou shunnest His righteous precepts.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 59:1
verses.text: That the Christian Should Be Such.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 59:2
verses.text: When the Lord says that man should eat bread with groaning, here what art thou now doing, who desirest to live with joy?  Thou seekest to rescind the judgment uttered by the highest God when He first formed man; thou wishest to abandon the curb of the law.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 59:3
verses.text: If the Almighty God have bidden thee live with sweat, thou who art living in pleasure wilt already be a stranger to Him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 59:4
verses.text: The Scripture saith that the Lord was angry with the Jews.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 59:5
verses.text: Their sons, refreshed with food, rose up to play.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 59:6
verses.text: Now, therefore, why do we follow these circumcised men?  In what respect they perished, we ought to beware; the greatest part of you, surrendered to luxuries, obey them.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 59:7
verses.text: Thou transgressest the law in staining thyself with dyes:  against thee the apostle cries out; yea, God cries out by him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 59:8
verses.text: Your dissoluteness, says he, in itself ruins you.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 59:9
verses.text: Be, then, such as Christ wishes you to be, gentle, and in Him joyful, for in the world you are sad.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 59:10
verses.text: Run, labour, sweat, fight with sadness.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 59:11
verses.text: Hope comes with labour, and the palm is given to victory.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 59:12
verses.text: If thou wishest to be refreshed, give help and encouragement to the martyr.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 59:13
verses.text: Wait for the repose to come in the passage of death.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:1
verses.text: To the Matrons of the Church of the Living God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:2
verses.text: Thou wishest, O Christian woman, that the matrons should be as the ladies of the world.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:3
verses.text: Thou surroundest thyself with gold, or with the modest silken garment.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:4
verses.text: Thou givest the terror of the law from thy ears to the wind.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:5
verses.text: Thou affectest vanity with all the pomp of the devil.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:6
verses.text: Thou art adorned at the looking-glass with thy curled hair turned back from thy brow.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:7
verses.text: And moreover, with evil purposes, thou puttest on false medicaments, on thy pure eyes the stibium, with painted beauty, or thou dyest thy hair that it may be always black.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:8
verses.text: God is the overlooker, who dives into each heart.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:9
verses.text: But these things are not necessary for modest women.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:10
verses.text: Pierce thy breast with chaste and modest feeling.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:11
verses.text: The law of God bears witness that such laws fail from the heart which believes; to a wife approved of her husband, let it suffice that she is so, not by her dress, but by her good disposition.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:12
verses.text: To put on clothes which the cold and the heat or too much sun demands, only that thou mayest be approved modest, and show forth the gifts of thy capacity among the people of God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:13
verses.text: Thou who wast formerly most illustrious, givest to thyself the guise of one who is contemptible.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:14
verses.text: She who lay without life, was raised by the prayers of the widows.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:15
verses.text: She deserved this, that she should be raised from death, not by her costly dress, but by her gifts.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:16
verses.text: Do ye, O good matrons, flee from the adornment of vanity; such attire is fitting for women who haunt the brothels.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:17
verses.text: Overcome the evil one, O modest women of Christ.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 60:18
verses.text: Show forth all your wealth in giving.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 61:1
verses.text: To the Same Again.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 61:2
verses.text: Hear my voice, thou who wishest to remain a Christian woman, in what way the blessed Paul commands you to be adorned.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 61:3
verses.text: Isaiah, moreover, the teacher and author that spoke from heaven, for he detests those who follow the wickedness of the world, says:  The daughters of Zion that are lifted up shall be brought low.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 61:4
verses.text: It is not right in God that a faithful Christian woman should be adorned.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 61:5
verses.text: Dost thou seek to go forth after the fashion of the Gentiles, O thou who art consecrated to God?  God's heralds, crying aloud in the law, condemn such to be unrighteous women, who in such wise adorn themselves.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 61:6
verses.text: Ye stain your hair; ye paint the opening of your eyes with black; ye lift up your pretty hair one by one on your painted brow; ye anoint your cheeks with some sort of ruddy colour laid on; and, moreover, earrings hang down with very heavy weight.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 61:7
verses.text: Ye bury your neck with necklaces; with gems and gold ye bind hands worthy of God with an evil presage.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 61:8
verses.text: Why should I tell of your dresses, or of the whole pomp of the devil?  Ye are rejecting the law when ye wish to please the world.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 61:9
verses.text: Ye dance in your houses; instead of psalms, ye sing love songs.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 61:10
verses.text: Thou, although thou mayest be chaste, dost not prove thyself so by following evil things.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 61:11
verses.text: Christ therefore makes you, such as you are, equal with the Gentiles.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 61:12
verses.text: Be pleasing to the hymned chorus, and to an appeased Christ with ardent love fervently offer your savour to Christ.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 62:1
verses.text: In the Church to All the People of God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 62:2
verses.text: I, brethren, am not righteous who am lifted up out of the filth, nor do I exalt myself; but I grieve for you, as seeing that out of so great a people, none is crowned in the contest; certainly, even if he does not himself fight, yet let him suggest encouragement to others.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 62:3
verses.text: Ye rebuke calamity; O belly, stuff yourself out with luxury.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 62:4
verses.text: The brother labours in arms with a world opposed to him; and dost thou, stuffed with wealth, neither fight, nor place thyself by his side when he is fighting?  O fool, dost not thou perceive that one is warring on behalf of many?  The whole Church is suspended on such a one if he conquers.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 62:5
verses.text: Thou seest that thy brother is withheld, and that he fights with the enemy.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 62:6
verses.text: Thou desirest peace in the camp, he outside rejects it.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 62:7
verses.text: Be pitiful, that thou mayest be before all things saved.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 62:8
verses.text: Neither dost thou fear the Lord, who cries aloud with such an utterance; even He who commands us to give food even to our enemies.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 62:9
verses.text: Look forward to thy meals from that Tobias who always on every day shared them entirely with the poor man.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 62:10
verses.text: Thou seekest to feed him, O fool, who feedeth thee again.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 62:11
verses.text: Dost thou wish that he should prepare for me, who is setting before him his burial?  The brother oppressed with want, nearly languishing away, cries out at the splendidly fed, and with distended belly.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 62:12
verses.text: What sayest thou of the Lord's day?  If he have not placed himself before, call forth a poor man from the crowd whom thou mayest take to thy dinner.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 62:13
verses.text: In the tablets is your hope from a Christ refreshed.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 63:1
verses.text: To Him Who Wishes for Martyrdom.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 63:2
verses.text: Since, O son, thou desirest martyrdom, hear.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 63:3
verses.text: Be thou such as Abel was, or such as Isaac himself, or Stephen, who chose for himself on the way the righteous life.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 63:4
verses.text: Thou indeed desirest that which is a matter suited for the blessed.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 63:5
verses.text: First of all, overcome the evil one with thy good acts by living well; and when He thy King shall see thee, be thou secure.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 63:6
verses.text: It is His own time, and we are living for both; so that if war fails, the martyrs shall go in peace.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 63:7
verses.text: Many indeed err who say, With our blood we have overcome the wicked one; and if he remains, they are unwilling to overcome.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 63:8
verses.text: He perishes by lying in wait, and the wicked thus feels it; but he that is lawful does not feel the punishments applied.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 63:9
verses.text: With exclamation and with eagerness beat thy breast with thy fists.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 63:10
verses.text: Even now, if thou hast conquered by good deeds, thou art a martyr in Him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 63:11
verses.text: Thou, therefore, who seekest to extol martyrdom with thy word, in peace clothe thyself with good deeds, and be secure.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:1
verses.text: The Daily War.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:2
verses.text: Thou seekest to wage war, O fool, as if wars were at peace.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:3
verses.text: From the first formed day in the end you fight.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:4
verses.text: Lust precipitates you, there is war; fight with it.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:5
verses.text: Luxury persuades, neglect it; thou hast overcome the war.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:6
verses.text: Be sparing of abundance of wine, lest by means of it thou shouldest go wrong.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:7
verses.text: Restrain thy tongue from cursing, because with it thou adorest the Lord.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:8
verses.text: Repress rage.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:9
verses.text: Make thyself peaceable to all.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:10
verses.text: Beware of trampling on thy inferiors when weighed down with miseries.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:11
verses.text: Lend thyself as a protector only, and do no hurt.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:12
verses.text: Lead yourselves in a righteous path, unstained by jealousy.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:13
verses.text: In thy riches make thyself gentle to those that are of little account.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:14
verses.text: Give of thy labour, clothe the naked.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:15
verses.text: Thus shalt thou conquer.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:16
verses.text: Lay snares for no man, since thou servest God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:17
verses.text: Look to the beginning, whence the envious enemy has perished.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:18
verses.text: I am not a teacher, but the law itself teaches by its proclamation.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 64:19
verses.text: Thou wearest such great words vainly, who in one moment seekest without labour to raise a martyrdom to Christ.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 65:1
verses.text: Of the Zeal of Concupiscence.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 65:2
verses.text: In desiring, thence thou perishest, whilst thou art burning with envy of thy neighbour.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 65:3
verses.text: Thou extinguishest thyself, when thou inflamest thyself within.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 65:4
verses.text: Thou art jealous, O envious man, of another who is struggling with evil, and desirest that thou mayest become equally the possessor of so much wealth.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 65:5
verses.text: The law does not thus behold him when thou seekest to fall upon him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 65:6
verses.text: Depending on all things, thou livest in the lust of gain; and although thou art guilty to thyself, thou condemnest thyself by thy own judgment.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 65:7
verses.text: The greedy survey of the eyes is never satisfied.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 65:8
verses.text: Now, therefore, if thou mayest return and consider, lust is vain…whence God cries out, Thou fool, this night thou art summoned.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 65:9
verses.text: Death rushes after thee.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 65:10
verses.text: Whose, then, shall be those talents?  By hiding the unrighteous gains in the concealed treasury, when the Lord shall supply to every one his daily life.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 65:11
verses.text: Let another accumulate; do thou seek to live well.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 65:12
verses.text: And when thy heart is conscious of God, thou shalt be victor over all things; yet I do not say that thou shouldest boast thyself in public, when thou art watching for thy day by living without fraud.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 65:13
verses.text: The bird perishes in the midst of food, or carelessly sticks fast in the bird-lime.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 65:14
verses.text: Think that in thy simplicity thou hast much to beware of.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 65:15
verses.text: Let others trangress these bounds.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 65:16
verses.text: Do thou always look forward.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 66:1
verses.text: They Who Give from Evil.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 66:2
verses.text: Why dost thou senselessly feign thyself good by the wound of another?  Whence thou bestowest, another is daily weeping.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 66:3
verses.text: Dost not thou believe that the Lord sees those things from heaven?  The Highest says, He does not prove of the gifts of the wicked.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 66:4
verses.text: Thou shalt break forth upon the wretched when thou shalt have gained a place.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 66:5
verses.text: One gives gifts that he may make another of no account; or if thou hast lent on usury, taking twenty-four per cent, thou wishest to bestow charity that thou mayest purge thyself, as being evil, with that which is evil.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 66:6
verses.text: The Almighty absolutely rejects such works as these.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 66:7
verses.text: Thou hast given that which has been wrung from tears; that candidate, oppressed with ungrateful usuries, and become needy, deplores it.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 66:8
verses.text: Besides having obtained an opportunity for the exactors, thy enemy for the present is the people; thou consecrated, hast become wicked for reward.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 66:9
verses.text: Also thou wishest to atone for thyself by the gain of wages.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 66:10
verses.text: O wicked one, thou deceivest thyself, but none else.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 67:1
verses.text: Of a Deceitful Peace.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 67:2
verses.text: The arranged time comes to our people; there is peace in the world; and, at the same time, ruin is weighing us down from the enticement of the world, (the destruction) of the reckless people whom ye have rent into schism.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 67:3
verses.text: Either obey the law of the city, or depart from it.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 67:4
verses.text: Ye behold the mote sticking in our eyes, and will not see the beam in your own.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 67:5
verses.text: A treacherous peace is coming to you; persecution is rife; the wounds do not appear; and thus, without slaughter, ye are destroyed.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 67:6
verses.text: War is waged in secret, because, in the midst of peace itself, scarcely one of you has behaved himself with caution.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 67:7
verses.text: O badly fortified, and foretold for slaughter, ye praise a treacherous peace, a peace that is mischievous to you.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 67:8
verses.text: Having become the soldiers of another than Christ, ye have perished.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 67:9
verses.text: I warn certain readers only to consider, and to give material to others by an example of life, to avoid strife, and to shun so many quarrels; to repress terror, and never to be proud; moreover, denounce the righteous obedience of wicked men.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 67:10
verses.text: Make yourselves like to Christ your Master, O little ones.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 67:11
verses.text: Be among the lilies of the field by your benefits; ye have become blessed when ye bear the edicts; ye are flowers in the congregation; ye are Christ's lanterns.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 67:12
verses.text: Keep what ye are, and ye shall be able to tell it.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 68:1
verses.text: To Ministers.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 68:2
verses.text: Exercise the mystery of Christ, O deacons, with purity; therefore, O ministers, do the commands of your Master; do not play the person of a righteous judge; strengthen your office by all things, as learned men, looking upwards, always devoted to the Supreme God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 68:3
verses.text: Render the faithful sacred ministries of the altar to God, prepared in divine matters to set an example; yourselves incline your head to the pastors, so shall it come to pass that ye may be approved of Christ.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 69:1
verses.text: To God's Shepherds.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 69:2
verses.text: A shepherd, if he shall have confessed, has doubled his conflict.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 69:3
verses.text: Moreover, the apostle bids that such should be teachers.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 69:4
verses.text: Let him be a patient ruler; let him know when he may relax the reins; let him terrify at first, and then anoint with honey; and let him first observe to do himself what he says.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 69:5
verses.text: The shepherd who minds worldly things is esteemed in fault, against whose countenance thou mightest dare to say anything.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 69:6
verses.text: Gehenna itself bubbles up in hell with rumours.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 69:7
verses.text: Woe to the wretched people which wavers with doubtful brow! if such a shepherd shall be present to it, it is almost ruined.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 69:8
verses.text: But a devout man restrains it, governing rightly.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 69:9
verses.text: The swarms are rejoiced under suitable kings; in such there is hope, and the entire Church lives.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 70:1
verses.text: I Speak to the Elder-Born.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 70:2
verses.text: The time demands that I alone should speak to you truth.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 70:3
verses.text: He is often admonished by one word which many refuse.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 70:4
verses.text: I wish you to turn your hatred against me alone, that the hearts of all may tremble at the tempter.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 70:5
verses.text: Look to the saying that truly begets hatred, (and consider) how many things I have lately indeed foretold concerning a delusive peace, while, alas, the enticing seducer has come upon you unawares, and because ye have not known how that his wiles were imminent, ye have perished; ye work absolutely bitter things, but that is itself the characteristic of the world; not any one for whom ye intercede acts for nothing.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 70:6
verses.text: He who takes refuge from your fire, plunges in the whirlpool.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 70:7
verses.text: Then the wretch, stripped naked, seeks assistance from you.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 70:8
verses.text: The judges themselves shudder at your frauds…of a shorter title, I should not labour at so many lines.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 70:9
verses.text: Ye who teach, look upon those to whom ye willingly tend, when for yourselves ye both receive banquets and feed upon them.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 70:10
verses.text: For those things are ye already almost entering the foundations of the earth.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 71:1
verses.text: To Visit the Sick.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 71:2
verses.text: If thy brother should be weak—I speak of the poor man—do not empty-handed visit such an one as he lies ill.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 71:3
verses.text: Do good under God; pay your obedience by your money.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 71:4
verses.text: Thence he shall be restored; or if he should perish, let a poor man be refreshed, who has nothing wherewith to pay you, but the Founder and Author of the world on his behalf.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 71:5
verses.text: Or if it should displease thee to go to the poor man, always hateful, send money, and something whence he may recover himself.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 71:6
verses.text: And, similarly, if thy poor sister lies upon a sick-bed, let your matrons begin to bear her victuals.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 71:7
verses.text: God Himself cries out, Break thy bread to the needy.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 71:8
verses.text: There is no need to visit with words, but with benefits.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 71:9
verses.text: It is wicked that thy brother should be sick through want of food.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 71:10
verses.text: Satisfy him not with words.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 71:11
verses.text: He needs meat and drink.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 71:12
verses.text: Look upon such assuredly weakened, who are not able to act for themselves.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 71:13
verses.text: Give to them at once.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 71:14
verses.text: I pledge my word that fourfold shall be given you by God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 72:1
verses.text: To the Poor in Health.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 72:2
verses.text: What can healthful poverty do, unless wealth be present?  Assuredly, if thou hast the means, at once communicate also to thy brother.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 72:3
verses.text: Be responsible to thyself for one, lest thou shouldst be said to be proud.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 72:4
verses.text: I promise that thou shalt live more secure than the rich man.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 72:5
verses.text: Receive into thy ears the teaching of the great Solomon:  God hates the poor man to be a pleader on high.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 72:6
verses.text: Therefore submit thyself, and give honour to Him that is powerful; for the soft speech—thou knowest the proverb—melts.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 72:7
verses.text: One is conquered by service, even although there be an ancient anger.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 72:8
verses.text: If the tongue be silent, thou hast found nothing better.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 72:9
verses.text: If there should not wholesomely be an art whereby life may be governed, either give aid or direction by the command of Him that is mighty.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 72:10
verses.text: Let it not shame or grieve you that a healthy man should have faith.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 72:11
verses.text: In the treasury, besides, thou oughtest to give of thy labour, even as that widow whom the Anointed One preferred.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 73:1
verses.text: That Sons are Not to Be Bewailed.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 73:2
verses.text: Although the death of sons leaves grief for the heart, yet it is not right either to go forth in black garments, or to bewail them.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 73:3
verses.text: The Lord prudently says that ye must grieve with the mind, not with outward show, which is finished in the week.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 73:4
verses.text: In the book of Solomon the promises of the Lord concerning the resurrection are forgotten if thou wouldest make thy sons martyrs, and thus with thy voice will bewail them.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 73:5
verses.text: Art thou not ashamed without restraint to lament thy sons, like the Gentiles?  Thou tearest thy face, thou beatest thy breast, thou takest off thy garments; and dost thou not fear the Lord, whose kingdom thou desirest to behold?  Mourn as it is right, but do not do wrong on their behalf.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 73:6
verses.text: Ye therefore are such.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 73:7
verses.text: What less than Gentiles are ye?  Ye do as the crowds that are descended from the diabolical stock.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 73:8
verses.text: Ye cry that they are extinct.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 73:9
verses.text: With what advantage, O false one, thou hast perished!  The father has not led his son with grief to be slain at the altar, nor has the prophet mourned over a deceased son with grief, nor even has a weeping parent.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 73:10
verses.text: But one devoted to God was hastily dying.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 74:1
verses.text: Of Funeral Pomp.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 74:2
verses.text: Thou who seekest to be careful of the pomp of death art in error.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 74:3
verses.text: As a servant of God, thou oughtest even in death to please Him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 74:4
verses.text: Alas that the lifeless body should be adorned in death!  O true vanity, to desire honour for the dead!  A mind enchained to the world; not even in death devoted to Christ.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 74:5
verses.text: Thou knowest the proverbs.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 74:6
verses.text: He wished to be carried through the forum.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 74:7
verses.text: Thus ye, who are like to him, and living with untrained mind, wish to have a happy and blessed day at your death, that the people may come together, and that you may see praise with mourning.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 74:8
verses.text: Thou dost not foresee whither thou mayest deserve to go when dead.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 74:9
verses.text: Lo, they are following thee; and thou, perchance, art already burning, being driven to punishment.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 74:10
verses.text: What will the pomp benefit the dead man?  Thou shalt be accused, who seekest them on account of those gatherings.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 74:11
verses.text: Thou desirest to live under idols.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 74:12
verses.text: Thou deceivest thyself.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 75:1
verses.text: To the Clerks.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 75:2
verses.text: They will assemble together at Easter, that day of ours most blessed; and let them rejoice, who ask for divine entertainments.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 75:3
verses.text: Let what is sufficient be expended upon them, wine and food.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 75:4
verses.text: Look back at the source whence these things may be told on your behalf.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 75:5
verses.text: Ye are wanting in a gift to Christ, in moderate expenditure.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 75:6
verses.text: Since ye yourselves do it not, in what manner can ye persuade the righteousness of the law to such people, even once in the year?  Thus often blasphemy suggests to many concerning you.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 76:1
verses.text: Of Those Who Gossip, and of Silence.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 76:2
verses.text: When a thing appears to anybody of no consequence, and is not shunned, and it rushes forth, as if easy, whilst thou abusest it.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 76:3
verses.text: Fables assist it when thou comest to pour out prayers, or to beat thy breast for thy daily sin.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 76:4
verses.text: The trumpet of the heralds sounds forth, while the reader is reading, that the ears may be open, and thou rather impedest them.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 76:5
verses.text: Thou art luxurious with thy lips, with which thou oughtest to groan.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 76:6
verses.text: Shut up thy breast to evils, or loose them in thy breast.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 76:7
verses.text: But since the possession of money gives barefacedness to the wealthy, thence every one perishes when they are most trusting to themselves.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 76:8
verses.text: Thus, moreover, the women assemble, as if they would enter the bath.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 76:9
verses.text: They press closely, and make of God's house as if it were a fair.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 76:10
verses.text: Certainly the Lord frightened the house of prayer.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 76:11
verses.text: The Lord's priest commanded with "sursum corda," when prayer was to be made, that your silence should be made.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 76:12
verses.text: Thou answerest fluently, and moreover abstainest not from promises.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 76:13
verses.text: He entreats the Highest on behalf of a devoted people, lest any one should perish, and thou turnest thyself to fables.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 76:14
verses.text: Thou mockest at him, or detractest from thy neighbour's reputation.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 76:15
verses.text: Thou speakest in an undisciplined manner, as if God were absent—as if He who made all things neither hears nor sees.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 77:1
verses.text: To the Drunkards.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 77:2
verses.text: I place no limit to a drunkard; but I prefer a beast.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 77:3
verses.text: From those who are proud in drinking thou withdrawest in thine inner mind, holding the power of the ruler, O fool, among Cyclopes.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 77:4
verses.text: Thence in the histories thou criest, While I am dead I drink not.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 77:5
verses.text: Be it mine to drink the best things, and to be wise in heart.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 77:6
verses.text: Rather give assistance (what more seekest thou to abuse?) to the lowest pauper, and ye shall both be refreshed.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 77:7
verses.text: If thou doest such things, thou extinguishest Gehenna for thyself.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 78:1
verses.text: To the Pastors.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 78:2
verses.text: Thou who seekest to feed others, and hast prepared what thou couldest by assiduously feeding, hast done rightly.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 78:3
verses.text: But still look after the poor man, who cannot feed thee again:  then will thy table be approved by the one God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 78:4
verses.text: The Almighty has bidden such even especially to be fed.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 78:5
verses.text: Consider, when thou feedest the sick, thou art also lending to the High One.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 78:6
verses.text: In that thing the Lord has wished that you should stand before Him approved.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 79:1
verses.text: To the Petitioners.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 79:2
verses.text: If thou desirest, when praying, to be heard from heaven, break the chains from the lurking-places of wickedness; or if, pitying the poor, thou prayest by thy benefits, doubt not but what thou shalt have asked may be given to the petitioner.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 79:3
verses.text: Then truly, if void of benefits, thou adorest God, do not thus at all make thy prayers vainly.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 80:1
verses.text: The Name of the Man of Gaza.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 80:2
verses.text: Ye who are to be inhabitants of the heavens with God-Christ, hold fast the beginning, look at all things from heaven.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 80:3
verses.text: Let simplicity, let meekness dwell in your body.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 80:4
verses.text: Be not angry with thy devout brother without a cause, for ye shall receive whatever ye may have done from him.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 80:5
verses.text: This has pleased Christ, that the dead should rise again, yea, with their bodies; and those, too, whom in this world the fire has burned, when six thousand years are completed, and the world has come to an end.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 80:6
verses.text: The heaven in the meantime is changed with an altered course, for then the wicked are burnt up with divine fire.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 80:7
verses.text: The creature with groaning burns with the anger of the highest God.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 80:8
verses.text: Those who are more worthy, and who are begotten of an illustrious stem, and the men of nobility under the conquered Antichrist, according to God's command living again in the world for a thousand years, indeed, that they may serve the saints, and the High One, under a servile yoke, that they may bear victuals on their neck.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 80:9
verses.text: Moreover, that they may be judged again when the reign is finished.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 80:10
verses.text: They who make God of no account when the thousandth year is finished shall perish by fire, when they themselves shall speak to the mountains.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 80:11
verses.text: All flesh in the monuments and tombs is restored according to its deed:  they are plunged in hell; they bear their punishments in the world; they are shown to them, and they read the things transacted from heaven; the reward according to one's deeds in a perpetual tyranny.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 80:12
verses.text: I cannot comprehend all things in a little treatise; the curiosity of the learned men shall find my name in this.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 81:1
verses.text: I know nothing of the second poem of our author, and am indebted for the following particulars to Dr.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 81:2
verses.text: Schaff.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 81:3
verses.text: It is an apologetic poem against Jews and Gentiles, written in uncouth hexameters, and discusses in forty-seven sections the doctrine concerning God and the Redeemer and mankind.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 81:4
verses.text: It treats of the names of Son and Father; and here, probably, he lays himself open to the charge of Patripassian heresy.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 81:5
verses.text: He passes to the obstacles encountered by the Gospel, warns the Jews and the Gentiles to forsake their unprofitable devotions, and enlarges on the eschatology, as he conceives of it.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 81:6
verses.text: Let me now quote textually, as follows:—  "The most interesting part of the second poem is the conclusion.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 81:7
verses.text: It contains a fuller description of Antichrist than the first poem.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 81:8
verses.text: The author expects that the end of the world will come with the seventh persecution.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 81:9
verses.text: The Goths will conquer Rome and redeem the Christians; but then Nero will appear as the heathen Antichrist, reconquer Rome, and rage against the Christians three years and a half.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 81:10
verses.text: He will be conquered in turn by the Jewish and real Antichrist from the East, who, after the defeat of Nero and the burning of Rome, will return to Judea, perform false miracles, and be worshipped by the Jews.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 81:11
verses.text: At last Christ appears, that is, God himself (from the Monarchian stand-point of the author) with the lost Twelve Tribes ? as his army, which had lived beyond Persia in happy simplicity and virtue.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 81:12
verses.text: Under astounding phenomena of nature he will conquer Antichrist and his host, convert all nations, and take possession of the holy city of Jerusalem".

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 81:13
verses.text: This idea of a double Antichrist re-appears in Lactantius, Inst.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 81:14
verses.text: Div.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 81:15
verses.text: , vii.

verses.name: Instructions of Commodianus 81:16
verses.text: seqq.
